remarks: A standard version of Axiom of Infinity of ZF set theory.  In English, it says: there exists a set that contains the empty set and the successors of all of its members.  Theorem ~ zfinf2 shows it converted to abbreviations.  This axiom was derived as theorem ~ axinf2 above, using our version of Infinity ~ ax-inf and the Axiom of Regularity ~ ax-reg .  We will reference ~ ax-inf2 instead of ~ axinf2 so that the ordinary uses of Regularity can be more easily identified.  The reverse derivation of ~ ax-inf from ~ ax-inf2 is shown by theorem ~ axinf . (Contributed by NM, 3-Nov-1996.)
statement:
ax-inf2 $p |- E. x ( E. y ( y e. x /\ A. z -. z e. y ) /\ A. y ( y e. x -> E. z ( z e. x /\ A. w ( w e. z <-> ( w e. y \/ w = y ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d w x y z $.
